byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Research was contributed by Cao Li, Vanessa Piao, Kiki Zhao and Adam Wu from Beijing.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and CHRIS BUCKLEY

abstract: Stature of China's Communist Party has been damaged by tumbling stock market; millions of China's middle-class investors are questioning why party and government supported market in months leading to its fall, and then stumbled in attempts to prevent rout.
lead_paragraph: Investors have asked why the Communist Party and the government talked up the markets in recent months and then bumbled in efforts to prevent the rout.

headline.main: Stock Market Plunge in China Dents Communist Party’s Stature
headline.print_headline: Market Plunge in China Dents Party’s Stature

snippet: Investors have asked why the Communist Party and the government talked up the markets in recent months and then bumbled in efforts to prevent the rout.
